page.title: 15The Village Hall
page.content: Great Doddington has a village hall which was built in memory of the villagers who died in the wars. It consists of a large hall, a committee room, a stage, a kitchen and toilets. It is used by all the village organisations for their meetings and extra functions and provides a focal point for village activities. It is also hired out to people for private functions and the revenue raised goes towards the upkeep of the hall. The costs have risen considerably in recent years and fund-raising events have to be organised. The main money comes from the village fete on the second Saturday in June each year and this year 500 pounds was raised. It is an occasion when all the village organisations including the village school rally round.
